intro: Alternanthera rosea, commonly known as the red flame plant, is a tropical perennial native to South America. It is characterized by its striking red to pink foliage, which becomes more vibrant in direct sunlight. The plant typically grows to a height of 12–18 inches and has lance-shaped leaves with a glossy texture. It produces small, inconspicuous white flowers that appear in clusters during the summer months. Alternanthera rosea thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade.
